body:
Thanks for the suggestion.

There might be some issues with this though since `shift` is already used to disable mouse mode for selection.

One scenario where the behavior might be unexpected, would be this:
 * Enable mouse mode
 * Make selection with shift+drag
 * cancel selection with left click+shift
 * keep holding shift to start a new selection

In this scenario it wouldn't be certain if a new selection should be started, from the point where the selection was cancelled, to the new start, or if the first click was just to cancel the selection.
I think there should be a way to resolve this, in this case it's probably best to just assume the first click was just to cancel the selection, but this becomes more complicated when there is no selection currently visible (but still present in the history).

Do you have any examples for terminal emulators which already do this? It might be nice to capture their behavior to make sure if Alacritty should receive this feature, that the behavior would be consistent and battle-tested.

gnome-terminal and OSX default Terminal app do this.
This is necessary when I have a huge output (>1000 lines) to select and copy.

@elbaro I'd hope that #1512 might be able to help with that a bit when it's in a better state.

If VTE supports this it should be simple to draw some comparisons there. Usually things are implemented in a reasonable way with VTE.

`xterm` does the same by left clicking somewhere and right clicking somewhere else (everything in between gets selected).

I think that the general idea of "mark start/end and select in between" is the interesting suggestion, the keys/shortcuts to achieve that are just a minor detail.

issue.title: Modify Text Selection
issue.body:
Allow the user to modify a selection. This can be triggered with either a key combination or modifier + mouse button. The end point of the selection will be moved to the mouse location.

The selection will still be cleared when clicking the mouse without any modifiers activated.

Fixes: #1554

issue.title: Force exact modifiers match for mouse bindings
Add selection expansion
issue.body:
This allows for expanding the selection using the shift key. The new
selection type depends on the number of clicks and applies to both sides
of the selection.

Fixes #1554.

body: We decided to go for right mouse button for selection expansion, since `Shift` is a bit overloaded with other implicit things already, and they were conflicting with each other.

issue.title: Mac: how to expand selection in upcoming 0.5 release
issue.body:
Hello Alacritty team,

This should be a quick query and resolution.

I see in the 0.5 release notes there will be selection expansion using the right-mouse button, not shift as noted [here](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1554#issuecomment-648043457).

On a Mac what will be combination to expand a selection, noting that Macbooks only have a trackpad and Mac desktop mice only have one button.

Double tap?
Ctrl + click?
Something else? Or both?

Regards.

P.S. Selection expansion is a very important feature, so I very much look forward to it's arrival. Currently I am still iTerm2 and GNOME Terminal; but that should soon change after 0.5.

issue.title: [Feature] word-based selection expansion
issue.body:
Hello Alacritty support,

One of the major features of the 0.5 release will be selection expansion via the right-mouse-button.

I have toyed with the release candidate and selection enhancement is a very nice addition, many thanks.

However, it is currently limited to character expansion only. Say for instance one double clicks a word, then expands the selection, the starting and end points will be character sliced depending on where the start and end clicks took place, which is a little jarring since the double click word boundary will suddenly disappear.

iTerm2 (via control-click) and GNOME Terminal (via shift-click) does character expansion if the original selection was a simply mouse drag, but they will do whole of word expansion if the original selection was a double click word selection. This proves useful in expanding a selection word-by-word-by-word, for example selecting a complete sentence.

Hopefully in future the same mechanism Alacritty already uses for double-click word selection can filter through to selection expansion allowing users word-by-word expansion in addition to the current character-by-character expansion.

Many thanks.

body: Would be good to document this more prominently.  It's a thing people run into early.

> We decided to go for right mouse button for selection expansion, since `Shift` is a bit overloaded with other implicit things already, and they were conflicting with each other.

Does `Shift + Mouse Click` do something else (you mentioned "conflicting")? I was super surprised to find out about `Click + Right Click`, I don't know any other software that works like this. Right click usually opens a context menu (Copy, Paste, etc.)
